title: Thunderbird Profile restore
creator: ruthnichollsphotos
content: Is it possible to copy just the Mail folder from a Thunderbird Profile backup in Time Machine on Mac? I have deleted an email account from Thunderbird and I did not tick Delete Data so the emails are still there in my Profile but they no longer show up in the tree in Thunderbird on my Mac ( OS 14.8 Sonoma). I had a lot of subfolders into which I had put incoming and sent emails on particular topics. For example I had a folder called Family, and inside that I had a subfolder called Birthdays as well as many other family related topics. My last Time Machine back up is about a month ago but that would be good enough to restore from. I tried ‘Import’ in Thunderbird but it only imported the main folders and the emails within but not the subfolders. I have another email address besides the deleted one and if I overwrite the whole Profile with the older one from Time Machine it will lose a lot of new stuff accumulated since that backup. Any help most appreciated

title: Thunderbird on new computer - missing Next & Previous on Inbox; opens all emails in folder when I click on one.
creator: KJS-LES
content:
My previous computer crashed and got a new one (Win 11 of course - new for me).

I downloaded Thunderbird. With the help of an Earthlink (my email) tech, all but one of my emails (gmail) were entered. Then I downloaded and began reading them.

The first thing I noticed was the Next and Previous buttons are missing (or placed where I don't see them).

The second thing I noticed is that when I click on one email to read, all the emails in the respective Inbox also open. This is very annoying.

I also hope someone can tell me the info I need to add a gmail account. (I rarely use it, but there two websites which require a gmail email to log on.)

And I had made a T-bird "backup" but haven't used it yet. I'd like to IF I can locate it.


P.S. Is it possible to shut off the AI "help" while writing this. I find it annoying, slows me down.

title: Cannot send emails from thunderbird version 147 but can send from thunderbird 140.5 ESR. Newer version is on a windows 11 Dell Pc.
creator: youngw1
content: I have a windows 11 pc with thunderbird 147 installed. It worked until Jan 16th, 2026. I added the account to my Linux pc that has thunderbird 140.5 ESR inststalled and it works fine with the account from the windows 11 pc.

title: Sort and Group Mails
creator: micet2004
content:
How could I setup a complex sorting rule? This rule I wish: 1. Sort by date and Group 2. sort Starred Mails at the top and unread mails second. 3. Group this also by DiscussionTread (Starred mails out of context is not helpfull)

I also would like to use this sorting on Android.

title: Links not clickable??? - 147.0 (64-bit) / Ubuntu
creator: c.lark397
content:
if I type a hyperlink into the Calendar description field it does not link to the url.

The mouse pointer does not change from a cursor to a pointy hand when I hover over it

I have also tried using the 'Link' button and that creates a blue/underlined url like a traditional clickable link but the result is the same as before.

Please help troubleshoot the problem, at the moment I'm having to copy and paste every link which becomes tedious when there are lots of links

Thanks

Clark
